snippet: Rajiv Shah, head of the United States Agency for International Development, has set off a fierce debate over the way the agency operates and the usefulness of traditional foreign aid.
abstract: Rajiv Shah, head of the United States Agency for International Development, has set off a fierce debate over the way the agency operates and will face tough questions about his $20 billion budget in testimony to Congress; under Shah, agency has upended traditional foreign aid, using loan guarantees from American corporations to secure local financing and projects like creating social media site to try to foment unrest in Cuba.
lead_paragraph: Rajiv Shah, head of the United States Agency for International Development, has set off a fierce debate over the way the agency operates and the usefulness of traditional foreign aid.

headline.main: In Switch, Development Agency Welcomes Business and Technology to Poverty Fight
headline.print_headline: In Switch, Development Agency Welcomes Business and Technology to Poverty Fight
